creator: Alexander Terp
description:
```
a = 0
for i in range(1000000):
    a += i

print(a)
```

Before the revamp, this would take ~0.2 seconds.

After, it's taking between 6 and 7 seconds.

The issue must not be tree sitter parsing - parsing is a flat cost.

Is our switch stmt approach really costly? Perhaps the switch stmt on Node kind strings?
title: RAD-146: Investigate performance after revamp
